name: io.bytes.per.checksum
description:
The number of bytes per checksum.  Must not be larger than
  io.file.buffer.size.

name: dfs.client.write.byte-array-manager.count-reset-time-period-ms
description:
The time period in milliseconds that the allocation count for each array length is
    reset to zero if there is no increment.

name: dfs.blockreport.intervalMsec
description: Determines block reporting interval in milliseconds.

name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.container.log.backups
description:
Number of backup files for the ApplicationMaster logs when using
    ContainerRollingLogAppender (CRLA). See
    org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender.maxBackupIndex. By default,
    ContainerLogAppender (CLA) is used, and container logs are not rolled. CRLA
    is enabled for the ApplicationMaster when both
    yarn.app.mapreduce.am.container.log.limit.kb and
    yarn.app.mapreduce.am.container.log.backups are greater than zero.

name: mapreduce.job.maxtaskfailures.per.tracker
description:
The number of task-failures on a node manager of a given job
               after which new tasks of that job aren't assigned to it. It
               MUST be less than mapreduce.map.maxattempts and
               mapreduce.reduce.maxattempts otherwise the failed task will
               never be tried on a different node.

name: dfs.namenode.replication.max-streams-hard-limit
description: Hard limit for all replication streams.

name: ftp.stream-buffer-size
description:
The size of buffer to stream files.
  The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware
  page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is
  buffered during read and write operations.

name: dfs.client-write-packet-size
description: Packet size for clients to write

name: mapreduce.task.stuck.timeout-ms
description:
The max timeout before receiving remote task's first heartbeat.
    This parameter is in order to avoid waiting for the container
    to start indefinitely, which made task stuck in the NEW state.
    A value of 0 disables the timeout.
